hypotheses.name: Third-party system dependency issues
hypotheses.description: Failures caused by reliance on external biller systems, which introduce latency, timeouts, and retry overhead especially during peak usage periods.
hypotheses.business_implication: Consider implementing circuit breakers or fallback payment methods during biller system outages

hypotheses.name: Validation and input complexity
hypotheses.description: Failures caused by multi-step validation requirements and user input errors, common in bill payments and recharges where multiple fields must be validated against external databases.
hypotheses.business_implication: Simplify input validation or provide better user guidance during transaction entry

hypotheses.name: Peak-hour load sensitivity
hypotheses.description: Infrastructure struggles under high transaction volumes during peak hours, leading to timeouts and capacity-related failures.
hypotheses.business_implication: Scale infrastructure horizontally during peak hours or implement request throttling

hypotheses.name: Scheduled maintenance windows
hypotheses.description: High failure rates during weekend or off-peak maintenance periods when partner banks or payment processors perform system updates.
hypotheses.business_implication: Coordinate maintenance schedules with partner banks or notify users of expected downtime

hypotheses.name: Network connectivity issues
hypotheses.description: Transaction failures correlated with poor network quality, particularly on 3G and unstable mobile connections causing request timeouts.
hypotheses.business_implication: Implement offline transaction queuing or retry logic for unstable connections

hypotheses.name: Device-platform specific failures
hypotheses.description: Certain device types or platforms experience disproportionately higher failure rates, suggesting app-level or OS-specific issues.
hypotheses.business_implication: Investigate platform-specific app issues and optimize for underperforming device types

hypotheses.name: High-value transaction risk patterns
hypotheses.description: Higher-value transactions show elevated failure or fraud-flag rates, suggesting stricter risk controls or additional verification steps causing friction.
hypotheses.business_implication: Review risk thresholds for high-value transactions to balance security with user experience

hypotheses.name: Bank-specific processing issues
hypotheses.description: Certain sender or receiver banks show systematically higher failure rates, indicating bank-side processing or connectivity problems.
hypotheses.business_implication: Engage with underperforming partner banks to improve API reliability and response times
